page.title: 04A Visit to the Brickworks.
page.content: 15 pupils from Whipton Middle School visited Westbrick.20 million bricks are made each year.3 million of these are handmade.The clay is quarried next door to the brickworks.It is then crushed into small lumps,ground into dust,mixed with water and sent to different parts of the factory to be moulded. The bricks are then stacked on 'kiln cars'. These run on rails and are pushed through the great long kiln.This takes one and a half days.It is gas-fired and the bricks reach a temperature of 1090 degrees.When they come out they are still at 120 degrees.Business is very good at present in these days of unemployment.They told us they could not make the bricks fast enough. By Christine Green and Alex Palmer (aged 12).
